details.description: Rather than giving each person/group individual feedback, the tutor creates a universally applicable set of feedback that is then presented to the whole class/cohort. All elements of the feedback need not be applicable to all groups/individuals, but there should be at least some relevant material in the whole feedback set. Often used in conjunction with some more individual feedback elements.
details.applicability: Best used with convergent assignments (where all solutions tend towards the same answer). Can be most effective when students frequently make the same mistakes.
details.consequences: Relevency and specificity of the feedback is reduced. Students can sometimes feel that the value of feedback is reduced.
